altUpDownArrows.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/183101?hl=en#pageshortcuts. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

appearDistance.description: In other words, “distance after which the button appears.”

browserActionPageTitle.message: Actieve tab instellingen | Scroll To Top Button

browserActionSttbDisabledDomain.message: Zet STTB uit voor dit domein

browserActionSttbDisabledUrl.message: Zet STTB uit voor deze URL

browserActionSttbEnabled.message: Zet Scroll To Top Button (STTB) aan

buttonHeightCustom.description: Lets user specify button height value in pixels instead of selecting a pre-set size.

buttonModeBrowserActionButtonTitle.message: Scroll naar de bovenkant van deze pagina

buttonSizeInPixels.description: Button size in pixels (length, width): 35x40 pixels

buttonWidthCustom.description: Lets user specify button width value in pixels instead of selecting a pre-set size.

clickthroughKeys.description: Before, user might have wanted to click an element located underneath/behind the button, but the button was in the way and there was no way to get rid of the button. Now, such user can hold a certain key on his/her keyboard and hover over the button and the button will disappear, allowing the user to comfortably click the previously inaccessible element.

clickthroughKeysTooltip.description: The tooltip that explains the “clickthrough keys” option in detail.
clickthroughKeysTooltip.message:
Vroeger had je misschien op een element willen klikken die onder/achter de knop zat, maar de knop zat in de weg en er was geen manier om de knop weg te halen.

Nu kan je een bepaalde toets op je toetsenbord ingedrukt houden en je muis boven de knop houden en dan zal de knop verdwijnen, zodat je gemakkelijk kan klikken op het voorheen ontoegankelijke element.

contextRightClickMenu.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chromebook/answer/183101?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

ctrlKey.description: Ctrl (Control on Macintosh keyboards) key + Click button.

ctrlKeyOrShiftKey.description: Ctrl (Control on Macintosh keyboards) or Shift key + Click button.

custom.description: Shows a number input field that lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.

dualArrows.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling to the top or bottom of a page. Always shows two arrows. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

extensionName.description: Please copy and paste the original/source string. Should NOT be translated.

flipBetweenTopBottom.description: The “flip” is when the button changes the direction: when you scroll down, the arrow points towards the top; when you scroll up, the arrow points towards the bottom. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

flipDistance.description: The “flip” is when the button changes the direction: when you scroll down, the arrow points towards the top; when you scroll up, the arrow points towards the bottom.

keyboardOnly.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling to the top or bottom of a page only with the help of keyboard shortcuts. No button(s) present on the page. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

keyboardShortcuts.description: Go to https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/157179?hl=en. Find text that resembles the source string. Replace “en” in the end of the URL with your language code. And find the translation in the same place.

language_bg.description:
Language option: bg (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).

If it doesn't match the current language, then write: *name of this language in the current language* - *native name of this language*.
If it does match the current language, then write: *native name of this language*.

Examples:
If the current language isn't English (United States) but Russian, this should say: Английский (Соединённые Штаты) - English (United States).
If the current language is English (United States), this should match it: English (United States).

language_browserDefault.description:
Language option.

If the extension supports the language that is chosen as default in the browser, use that one. Otherwise, use English (United States).

language_browserDefault_tooltip.description: Explanation of the “Automatic (browser default)” language option that should be shown in a tooltip.
language_browserDefault_tooltip.message: Als de extensie de taal ondersteunt die in de browser is ingesteld als standaard, gebruik dan die. Gebruik anders Engels (Verenigde Staten).

notActiveButtonOpacity.description: In other words, “Opacity of inactive button.”

officialWebsite.description: It might be called an “official website”, but since it's more of a landing page (for now) than a full website calling it just a “homepage” seems reasonable.

releaseNotes.message: Opmerkingen bij deze uitgave

scrollDownSpeedCustom.description: Lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.
scrollDownSpeedCustom.message: Snelheid naar beneden scrollen in milliseconden

scrollToTopOnly.description: Name of a button mode that allows scrolling only to the top of a page. Context: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5961162/71781066-3254ed00-2f7f-11ea-8dbf-8d61ed0fc9a2.png

scrollUpSpeedCustom.description: Lets user specify scroll up speed value in milliseconds instead of selecting a pre-set one.
scrollUpSpeedCustom.message: Snelheid naar boven scrollen in milliseconden

translatedBy.description: To give translators proper credit, this will be displayed somewhere on the Options page, so that people know who translated it for them. Example: “Translated by John Doe aka johndoesttb”

uiLanguage.description: Setting on the Options page: language of the user interface.
